summary: Frank L Eccles is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) based on payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978. The documents list his name, position, and salary details during these periods. While the specific role of Frank L Eccles within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Frank L Eccles' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll certifications confirm his role as a staff member during a specific timeframe of the committee's activities, although the exact nature and impact of his contribution are not specified in these documents.
